Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The study of exact solutions to the Einstein equations has played a crucial role in understanding many aspects of general relativity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, it is often difficult to construct such solutions as they require solving complicated nonlinear partial differential equations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This problem becomes even more challenging when considering physically interesting situations than those involving rotation and/or matter fields.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Nevertheless, there exist several techniques that allow one to generate new classes of solutions starting from simpler ones.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Such transformations preserve certain geometric properties of the spacetime while changing others; see [2] -

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [4] for reviews.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, since the transformed solution satisfies the vacuum Einstein equations then so does the original one [5] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 The concept of dynamical 3-space was introduced in this review article as an alternative to the standard space-time picture of relativistic physics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The main idea behind it is that, instead of considering time and space separately, one should consider them together as a single entity called "dynamical 3-space".

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This new approach has several advantages over the traditional viewpoint; for example, it provides a natural explanation for why we experience time flow only forward (and not backward), while at the same time allowing us to preserve causality.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, it also allows us to explain how particles can travel faster than light without violating any physical laws.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, by introducing the concept of "quantum potential energy density" into our description of matter fields, we are able to provide a simple mathematical framework within which all known fundamental interactions between elementary particles may be described.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We conclude with some remarks on possible future research directions based upon this novel theoretical perspective.

 We show that selection against demographic stochasticity leads to increased reproductive effort early in life (i.e., earlier reproduction) and decreased mortality rates later in life.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This is because higher reproductive efforts increase offspring numbers but also lead to more deaths due to competition for resources among siblings.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In contrast, lower mortality rates decrease sibling competition and thus reduce the number of deaths caused by this source of demographic stochasticity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results are robust at different levels of environmental stochasticity and initial conditions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The evolutionary consequences of demographic stochasticity have become studied extensively in recent years

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, most studies on this topic focus on populations without age structure or assume that all individuals reproduce at the same age

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [4–6] , which would not be realistic

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here we use an age-structured model of stochastic demographic events

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [10, 11] to investigate how selection acts on life-history traits when there is variation in individual ages at first reproduction

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Specifically, we consider a scenario where individuals will reproduce at various ages and compete for limited resources within their family groups

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that selection against demographic stochasticities increases reproductive effort early in life and decreases mortality rates late in life.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These findings are consistent with previous theoretical work showing that selection favors reduced variance in offspring number [14–18] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We study evolutionary dynamics in an ensemble of genotypes, each with its own fitness value and connected to other genotypes by mutations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that for large ensembles there is always one genotype which has more connections than any other genotype.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This genotype dominates all others in equilibrium.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The dominance in this genotype depends only on the distribution of mutational distances between pairs of genotypes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, if we consider two different distributions of mutational distances (the exponential and power law), then the same genotype will dominate both cases.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, the time it takes to reach equilibrium may be very different depending on how many paths lead away from the dominant genotype.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For particular, when the number of paths leading away from the dominant genotype increases exponentially as a function of distance, the system reaches equilibrium much faster compared to the case where the number of paths grows slower or even remains constant.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also find that the average population size of the dominant genotype decreases slowly over time until reaching equilibrium.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [1] relates type IIB superstrings propagating through ten-dimensional anti-de Sitter space-time (AdS) to conformal field theories living on its four-dimensional boundary.

 We present an efficient numerical scheme to detect the existence of periodic orbits in chaotically behaving dynamical systems, such as chaotic maps or chaotic flows.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, it has been shown that finding all periodic orbits of a given periodicity may not always be possible due to their complicated nature

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 They do not guarantee convergence towards the desired orbit.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here we propose a novel numerical scheme to overcome these difficulties without using the concept of shadowing [9] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 We show that any physical realization of the quantum NOT gate must come accompanied by an energy cost, which is bounded below by a universal constant times the number of qubits in the system.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

For both cases, we fix the normalization factor A by requiring that the integral of f(p,z) over all momenta equals unity.

 1 Introduction Code-division-multiple-access (CDMA) has been widely used as one of the most promising technologies for next-generation wireless communications due to its high spectral efficiency [1] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, CDMA suffers from severe interference between users caused by multipath propagation [2] , especially when the number of active users increases [3] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 To mitigate inter-user interference, multiuser detectors have been developed [4] - [6] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Among them, linear multiuser detectors are attractive because they can been implemented easily at low cost [7] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Unfortunately, these detectors suffer from performance loss compared to optimal multiuser detectors [8] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 To improve their performance, nonlinear multiuser detectors such as successive interference cancellation [9] or parallel interference cancellation [10] were introduced.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These detectors require accurate knowledge of the received signals [11] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Therefore, blind multiuser detectors

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [12] - [14] are proposed to estimate unknown parameters without any training sequence [15] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Since blind multiuser detectors do not need prior information about the received signal, they usually perform worse than conventional multiuser detectors [16] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Recently, there has been growing interest in developing multiuser detectors for time-varying channels

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As the channel varies over time, it becomes more difficult to detect the transmitted symbol accurately [21] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Moreover, if the channel changes rapidly, then the detector may fail completely [22] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Thus, it is important to design robust multiuser detectors with rapid channel variations [23] .

 We present exact solutions of the field equations of the Einstein-Gauss-Bonet (EGB) gravity with negative cosmological constant in 5D space-time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that there are three classes of black hole solutions depending on whether the Gauss-Bonnet coupling constant is positive or negative.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The first class contains two types of static spherically symmetric black holes which have no horizons but possess naked singularities at their centers.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition we also obtain another type of solution describing an asymptotically anti-de Sitter wormhole whose throat connects two asymptotic regions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, by using the method developed recently by one of us, we construct a new type of solution representing a time-dependent spacetime horn.

 I. INTRODUCTORY REMARK

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The discovery of gravitational waves has opened up a new window into our understanding of gravitation

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [1] , especially when it comes to testing general relativity [2] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, after its successes, general relativity still fails to explain some phenomena such as dark energy [3] and quantum gravity

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Therefore, many alternative theories of gravity were proposed over the years [5] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 One of these alternatives is the so-called Einstein-Gauss-Bonnet (EGB) gravity

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 The structure and dynamics of lipid membranes are important for many biological processes, such as cell division or protein transport across the membrane.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work we use atomic force microscopy to investigate the structural properties of stacked layers of phospholipids in water.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that these structures form spontaneously on mica surfaces at room temperature within minutes after adding the lipids into solution.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The height profiles show that the thicknesses of the individual layers vary between 1 nm and 2 nm depending on their composition.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 By analyzing the lateral diffusion coefficients of single molecules with respect to time, we can determine if they are mobile or immobile.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results indicate that the mobility is strongly dependent on the number of layers present in each stack.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, while most of the molecules in one layer diffuse freely over large distances, those in two layers exhibit only small displacements perpendicular to the surface.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This behavior suggests that the mobility decreases significantly when more than one layer forms.

 We study the ground state properties in the spin-1/2 square lattice with nearest-neighbor antiferromagnetic interactions and vacancies, using exact diagonalization (ED) on finite clusters up to 12x12 sites.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, we observe an increase of the density of states at zero energy when increasing the concentration of vacancies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This effect can be explained by considering the formation of bound pairs of vacancies which are localized around each other due to their mutual interaction.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The binding energies for these pairs depend strongly on the distance between them but only weakly on the size of the cluster considered.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, we show how this behavior changes if one considers next-nearest neighbor interactions instead of nearest-neighbor ones.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we discuss possible experimental realizations for our results.

 We present the results from our investigation into accretion disk continuum emission in black hole candidates (BHCs).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We have developed an analytical model for calculating the spectrum emitted by a thin, optically thick accretion disk around a Schwarzschild black hole and applied it to several BHCs with known mass functions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 Keywords: Black holes -- Spectroscopy -- X-rays -- Modeling -- Accretion disks -- Emission lines -- Broad-band spectral energy distribution -- Luminosity function -- Mass measurement -- Stellar-mass black holes -- Supermassive black holes -- Active galactic nuclei -- Quasars -- Cosmic evolution         1 Introduction     In recent years has have been considerable progress made towards understanding the physical processes occurring near supermassive black holes (SMBH) in active galactic nuclei (AGN), quasars, and other similar systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, if one knows how much light passes through some region of interest within an AGN then one may calculate its luminosity using simple geometric arguments.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Unfortunately, both of these approaches require detailed knowledge about the structure of the emitting regions which cannot currently be obtained observationally.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 We propose an improved metric in the space of worldsheet sigma model couplings that is suitable to study gradient renormalization group flows beyond first order in perturbation theory.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The new metric has several advantages over previous proposals, including manifestly positive kinetic terms and no need for additional counterterms at higher orders.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 Introduction: It was recently shown [1] that the worldsheet sigma-model (WSSM) provides a powerful framework for investigating quantum gravity via its connection to the gravitational path integral [2] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 One particularly interesting aspect to this approach is the possibility of computing perturbative corrections to the WSSM action directly from the gravitational path integral without having to resort to explicit calculations involving gravitons or graviton loops [3] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In [4] it was proposed that the WSSM could also be used to investigate the flow of the effective action under the renormalization group (RG).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, since the WSSM contains infinitely many degrees of freedom there does not exist any finite dimensional parameter space where the RG flow takes place.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Instead, the RG flow must take place along some infinite-dimensional trajectory through the space of all possible actions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 To make progress towards understanding such trajectories it would be helpful if one were able to define a sensible metric on the space of WSSM actions so that distances between different actions could be measured.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Such a metric should allow one to determine whether two given actions lie close together or far apart in the space of all possible WSSMs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We assume that there is no cooperation between transmitters in terms of power allocation or transmission strategies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Each transmitter can only adjust its own transmit power level based on local CSI knowledge at the transmitter side.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, each transmitter must turn off its radio completely when it does not have any data to send.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The objective is to maximize the sum rate by optimizing both the power control policy as well as the transmission strategy for all users simultaneously under these constraints.

 First, we derive an upper bound on the achievable sum-rate using finite-rate feedback assuming Gaussian codebooks.

 These results provide an explanation for why there appears to be no correlation between the size distribution of KBOs and their orbital eccentricity.

 We study the effect on temperature dependent shape anisotropy in an exchange coupled system consisting of two identical uniaxial single domain particles, one being magnetically softer than the other and both having their easy axes parallel to each other.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This can be understood by considering the competition between the Zeeman energy barrier due to the applied magnetic field and the thermal activation energy barrier associated with the temperature dependence of the shape anisotropy.

 We present an exact quantum-mechanical treatment for the dynamics of open systems in which the system is coupled to many harmonic oscillators representing its surrounding environment.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that, under certain conditions, this model can be reduced exactly into a master equation with Lindblad form.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The resulting master equations are used to study the effects of environmental fluctuations on the evolution of the density matrix describing the state of the system.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular we consider two different models of environments corresponding to Ohmic dissipation and spin-boson interaction respectively.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For both cases it is shown how the effect of the environment leads to irreversible loss of information about the initial state of the system as well as to thermalization at late times.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we discuss possible applications of our results to problems such as transport through mesoscopic conductors or dissipative tunneling between localized states in disordered solids.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Decoherence and relaxation processes play a crucial role for understanding the physics of open quantum systems

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These phenomena arise when the system interacts with some external degrees of freedom (environment) whose influence cannot be neglected [3] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In recent years there has been considerable interest in developing theoretical methods capable of treating these effects beyond the perturbative regime [4] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A number of approaches have be proposed ranging from phenomenological treatments based on stochastic Schrödinger equations [5] , to more microscopic descriptions using path integral techniques [6] or field-theoretical formulations [7, 8] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, despite their successes, all these methods suffer from one common drawback: they may not provide any insight into the underlying physical mechanisms responsible for decoherence and relaxation; nor can they allow us to make quantitative predictions regarding the time scales involved [9] .

 Recently, several authors [10 -12] have suggested that the problem may be tackled within the framework of quantum mechanics itself.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This idea was first put forward by Feynman

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [13] who showed that the statistical properties of macroscopic objects could be obtained by averaging over an ensemble of identical but microscopically distinct realizations of the same experiment.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 More recently, Leggett [14] introduced the method.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 The Standard Model (SM) is an extremely successful theory, but it leaves many questions unanswered about physics at very high energies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, there are no known fundamental principles that can explain why the SM has three generations of quarks and leptons with such different masses or how gravity fits into this picture.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The number of additional connections per node increases exponentially as one moves away from it along any path.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that this property can be used to construct efficient routing tables for such networks.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results are based on a new concept called "expanding dimension".

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This concept allows us to define a natural hierarchy for the nodes of our network.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, we prove that if there exists a polynomial time algorithm for finding shortest paths between two given nodes then there must exist another polynomial time algorithm for solving the same problem but restricted only to pairs of nodes whose distance belongs to a certain range.

This value agrees well with previous theoretical results obtained within the generalized gradient approximation but disagrees significantly with experimental values which are typically larger by about 0.5-0.7 eV. Our calculations show that the discrepancy can been attributed mainly to the neglect of dispersion interactions in earlier studies.

 We present an exact solution to the classical equations of motion in two dimensions, which are interpreted as describing a rotating black hole with angular momentum J = M .

 The metric has the form ds2 = −dt2+(1+cosh2r)dθ2−r2dr2, where r and θ are polar coordinates of the plane.

 Introduction:-In recent years there have been many attempts to construct solutions to Einstein's field equations corresponding to rotating black holes [1] - [4] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 One particularly interesting class of such solutions were found by Bañados, Teitelboim and Zanelli (BTZ), who showed how one could obtain a static black hole solution in three dimensional anti-de Sitter space-time [5] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The most important feature of these solutions is their asymptotic behaviour; they describe black holes whose event horizons were completely determined by global quantities like total energy or charge [6] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, despite being very useful tools for studying quantum gravity phenomena [7, 8] , these solutions did not provide any information about local properties of the spacetime near the horizon [9] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It would therefore seem desirable to try to extend them into more complicated geometries containing additional parameters characterizing the internal structure of the black hole [10] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 One way of doing so is to consider higher-dimensional extensions of the BTZ solution [11] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Another possibility is to perform a duality transformation for known solutions [12] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, if we start with the Schwarzschild solution written in terms of spherical coordinates, then after applying a suitable coordinate transformation we will get another solution expressed in terms of oblate spheroidal coordinates [13] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The process involves condensing atmospheric moisture into liquid water using solar power and then collecting this water on a surface coated with hydrophobic materials that allow it to become easily transported by air currents.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 The measurement calculus is an extension to the standard quantum mechanics formalism that allows for measurements on composite systems, and it has become used in several recent works as well as in this thesis.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The main idea behind the measurement calculus is to consider all possible outcomes of a measurement process as separate states of the system being measured instead of just one outcome (as done by von Neumann).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This approach leads naturally into considering the set of all possible measurement results as a new state space called the effect algebra.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, the measurement calculus provides a way to describe how different measurement processes can be combined into more complex ones using so-called instruments.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, the measurement calculus also includes a description of what happens when we perform a measurement on a system whose state is not known exactly but only up to some uncertainty.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The measurement calculus was first introduced by Aharonov et al., and since then there have been many papers written about its properties and applications.

 We introduce the notion for covering homology, which is an extension of ordinary homology to infinite graphs and simplicial complexes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The main idea behind this concept is that we consider not only finite subcomplexes but also their infinite analogues - so-called coverings.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show how covering homology can get used for studying properties of infinite graphs such as amenability or hyperbolicity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, we prove that if a graph has infinitely many ends then its first covering homology group vanishes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This result generalizes the classical theorem by Stallings on groups with infinitely many ends.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Covering homology provides us with new tools for investigating various classes of infinite objects in mathematics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It turns out that it was closely related to other concepts like equivariant homology theory (in the case when our object admits actions of some group) or higher-order algebraic K-theory.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we present several examples illustrating applications of covering homology.

 We find that the galaxy distribution is well described by a single NFW profile out to at least 1 Mpc/h.  Using this mass model we derive a virial mass for the cluster of Mvir = 2.1 x 1015M⊙/h70 within R200 = 0.9 h-1 70 Mpc/h.

 The geometry of time is the study of how space-time evolves in time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The axiom of choice states that for any collection of non-empty sets there exists at least one set which contains exactly one element from each set.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this article we show that if the universe has an underlying quantum structure then it follows that the geometry of time can been described by using the axiom of choice to select a single point on every trajectory through spacetime.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also discuss some possible implications of our results for neurobiology where the quantum Zeno effect could play a role in explaining certain aspects of brain function such as consciousness.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The geometry of time is the mathematical description of how space-time evolutes over time [1] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It is first introduced into physics by Hermann Minkowski

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [2] who showed that the geometry of space-time could been represented by four numbers (x,y,z,t) called coordinates or co-ordinates.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These were related by the following equation:  x2+y2-z2-t2=(c^2)(1-(v/c))1/2   Where c represents the speed of light and v represents the velocity of the object being observed.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This equation describes the relationship of distance travelled along the x-axis, y-axis, z-axis and t-axis respectively.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, if you were observing someone walking across your living room floor with their back towards you they would have a positive value for the x-axis but no values for the other three axes because they are not moving in those directions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 If however you were watching them walk away from you they would have negative values for all three axes except the x-axis since they are still travelling forward in that direction.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As another example consider two objects traveling side-by-side down a roadway.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 They will both travel at the same speed so their velocities will be equal.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, if one car travels north while the other travels south they will appear to move faster than each other even though they are traveling at the same speed.

 The proposed scheme consists in two parts: (i) A quantizer design based on the Lloyd-Max algorithm; (ii)

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 An encoding-decoding strategy using successive refinement coding to achieve the desired distortion level while satisfying the average power constraints.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results show that the proposed scheme can be implemented efficiently even when the number of sensors grows large.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, we provide numerical examples to illustrate our theoretical findings.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we discuss some possible extensions to our work.

 From this work, we propose a novel cross-layer scheme to improve the performance of distributed wireless ad hoc networks (DWAHNs).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The proposed scheme is based on an adaptive routing protocol and a dynamic channel allocation algorithm.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For particular, our approach uses a new metric called "expected transmission count" in order to select routes with minimum expected number of transmissions per packet delivery.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Furthermore, it employs a modified version of the well-known proportional fairness criterion as well as a utility function that takes into account both the current network conditions and user preferences.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Results show that the proposed scheme outperforms existing approaches by achieving higher throughput while maintaining low end-to-end delay and packet loss rate.

 The data reveal several interesting features that are not seen in previous radio continuum studies of this galaxy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that circularly polarized light can been used to control the valley polarization of photoexcited carriers by optical pumping at room temperature.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This work opens up new opportunities in exploring novel valleytronic devices based on 2D materials.

 The dynamics-based approach is an emerging method of studying terrestrial exoplanets, which are planets with masses similar to that of Earth orbiting other stars in the solar system.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The main goal of this research is to study how these planets form and evolve over time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This approach uses numerical simulations to model the formation and evolution in planetary systems by solving equations describing the orbital motion of bodies interacting gravitationally.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, it also takes into account physical processes such as tidal dissipation, collisions between planetesimals (small rocky objects), and atmospheric escape.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 By using this approach we can better understand how our own planet formed billions of years ago and what conditions were necessary for life on Earth to develop.

 Keywords: Planetary Science; Astrobiology; Tidal Dissipation; Collisions Between Planetesimals; Atmospheric Escape.

 Introduction:  The dynamics-based approach is an emergent method of studying terrestrial extrasolar planets, or planets with masses similar to Earth's orbiting other stars within the Solar System.

 The main goal of the dynamics-based approach is to study how these worlds form and evolve over time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Additionally, it incorporates physical processes including tidal dissipation, collisions among planetesimals (smaller rocky objects) and atmospheric escape.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 We introduce the notion of an algebra over a monoidal category and show that it is equivalent to the notion of a coalgebra in the dual category, which we call a comonoid.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We then define the cyclic homology of such algebras as the Hochschild cohomology of their underlying comonoids with coefficients in the bimodule given by the tensor product of the algebra with its opposite algebra.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This definition generalizes the usual one for ordinary algebras over fields or rings.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, if the base ring has characteristic zero, this recovers the classical definitions of cyclic homology and periodic cyclic homology.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 [Bök] , who showed how they could get used to construct new algebraic structures like crossed modules and group extensions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 We present the first provably optimal cache-oblivious layouts for meshes with arbitrary aspect ratios and dimensions, which are based on recursive striping into rectangular tiles.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The layout problem was formulated as an optimization problem: given a set of objects that need to be stored in memory, we want to find their positions so that they can be accessed most efficiently by future queries.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work, we consider the following scenario: A large amount of data needs to be stored in main memory (e.g., a database).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This data consists of many small objects (e.g., records) whose sizes vary greatly; some may even be larger than available space.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 To solve this problem, one could use a standard technique called blocking: each object is divided into blocks of equal size, and then these blocks are placed contiguously within the allocated storage area.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, if there are too few blocks per object, it will not fit entirely inside its assigned block; similarly, if there are too many blocks per object, the unused space between them cannot be used effectively.

 We revisit the foundations of quantum mechanics by introducing an alternative formulation to the standard Feynman path integral approach, which is based on the concept of dynamical phase transition (DPT).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that this new formalism provides a natural description for the emergence and evolution of macroscopic order in open quantum systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular we demonstrate how it can been used to describe the spontaneous emission process in atomic physics, where the atom-field interaction leads to the formation of collective states with well-defined photon number statistics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The proposed framework also allows us to study the dynamics of many-body interacting systems beyond mean field theory.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we discuss possible applications of our results to condensed matter physics and quantum information science.

 Introduction:-The development of modern theoretical approaches has led to significant progress in understanding the physical properties of complex quantum systems [1] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, despite these advances there are still fundamental questions about the nature of quantum phenomena that remain unanswered [2] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In recent years, several authors have attempted to address some of these issues using concepts borrowed from statistical mechanics [3] , such as entropy [4] or free energy [5] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These ideas were originally developed within the context of classical thermodynamics

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [6] but they have been recently extended to the realm of quantum mechanics

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 associated to the density matrix ρ describing the state of a system

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 More specifically, if the entropy production rate vanishes then the corresponding quantum mechanical model exhibits reversible dynamics

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 On the other hand, when the entropy production rate becomes positive the system undergoes a non-equilibrium phase transition [14] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 On the contrary, observations suggest that GRBs exhibit large diversity

 Finally, the nature of the progenitors of GRBs remains unknown [13] .

 The talk would also cover recent developments related to dualities between different quantum field theories.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This includes duality relations that have been found using the generalized twistor transform such as those relating N=4 super Yang-Mills theory to self-dual gravity and its supersymmetric extensions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally we will discuss how these ideas were connected to string theory.

 Generalized twistors are introduced by Witten more than twenty years ago [1] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 They provide a powerful tool for studying gauge theories in general relativity [2] , and they play important roles in understanding various aspects of string/M-theory [3] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For particular, the so-called Penrose limit [4] provides a way to relate scattering amplitudes in gauge/gravity theories at weak coupling to correlation functions in conformal field theories (CFTs) at strong coupling [5] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Recently there has been renewed interest in the study of twistors [6] -

 [11] due to their applications in computing scattering amplitudes [12] - [16] .

 For example, the tree-level S-matrix elements of gluons [17] and gravitons [18] in four-dimensional N = 4 Super-Yang-Mills theory (SYM), which are conjectured to be dual to type-IIB superstrings [19] , were computed via the generalized twistor transform [20] .

 In this article, we study cuspidal representations of general linear groups over discrete valuation rings.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We prove that if the residue field is infinite and has characteristic zero then any irreducible representation which is unramified outside a finite set of primes is supercuspidal (Theorem 3).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This result is previously known only for number fields.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In an application, we show how to construct new examples of supercuspidal representations by taking tensor products with characters of tori (Proposition 4).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also give some results on the structure of the space of smooth functions on G(R) where G is a reductive group defined over Q p .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, we show that if G = GL n , SL n or Sp 2n then there exists a dense subspace of smooth functions invariant under right translation by elements in G(Q p ) (Corollary 5).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we use these results to compute the dimension of certain spaces of automorphic forms attached to cuspidal representations of GL 2 (A) (Propositions 6 and 7).

 We present the results of our investigation into how stellar evolution models were affected by individual element abundances in stars, focusing on the sensitivity to changes in helium abundance (Y).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We use two different sets for evolutionary tracks with varying Y values for masses between 0.8 M⊙ and 8 M⊙ at solar metallicity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The first set was based on the Padova code while the second one uses the Geneva code.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For each track we calculate synthetic spectra using the SPECTRUM code.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These synthetic spectra are then used as input to determine the best-fit parameters of observed high-resolution optical spectra of Galactic open clusters.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our analysis shows that both codes produce similar results when fitting these cluster data.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, there are significant differences in the derived ages depending on which code was used.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This discrepancy can be explained by the fact that the Padova tracks have been calculated without convective overshooting whereas the Geneva tracks include this effect.

 We present new results on the detection rate, mass distribution, and orbital properties of hypervelocity stars (HVSs) in the Galactic halo based on spectroscopic observations with Keck II/DEIMOS over three years.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that HVSs were detected at a rate of 0.5 +/- 0.2 per year within 100 pc of the Galactic center.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The observed number density profile is consistent to an exponential fall-off with distance from the Galactic center.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our sample contains two HVSs with velocities greater than 1000 km/s; one has a heliocentric radial velocity of 1240 km/s and another has 1420 km/s.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These high velocities suggest that these objects are ejected by gravitational slingshots during close encounters between massive black holes or neutron stars.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition to the known population of HVSs near the Sun, we also detect a large number of high-velocity stars located farther away from the Galactic center which may become associated with other nearby supermassive black holes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The nucleon is described as an extended object with internal structure, which can be probed by elastic scattering experiments at high energies and small momentum transfers.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The present work focuses upon the investigation of chiral mechanisms leading to orbital quantum structures within the framework of effective field theory (EFT).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular we study the role played by pionic degrees of freedom for the description of the nucleon's electromagnetic form factors.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that the inclusion of explicit pions leads to significant improvements over previous calculations based solely on quark degrees of freedom.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Furthermore, we demonstrate how the EFT approach allows one to systematically include higher-order corrections in the calculation of observables.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we discuss possible extensions to our formalism towards the treatment of other hadronic systems such as nuclei or hypernuclei.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The nucleon is described as a composite system consisting of quarks bound together via gluons.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, it has become known since the early days of QCD

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [1] , that this picture cannot fully explain all experimental observations

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, while the proton's electric charge radius agrees well with experiment

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [3] , its magnetic moment turns out to be about 30% larger than expected [4] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In order to resolve these discrepancies between theoretical predictions and experimental data, it was suggested [5] that additional contributions arising from the presence of virtual mesonic fluctuations should be taken into account

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The so-called "meson-cloud" effects are particularly important when considering processes involving large momentum transfer [7, 8] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It has also been shown [9] that they play an essential role in describing the nucleon's electromagnetic properties [10] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We study the charge ordering phenomena in one-dimensional solids by using the exact diagonalization method and density matrix renormalization group (DMRG) technique.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that there are two types of charge orderings, i.e., stripe-like and checkerboard-like orders depending on the electron filling factor n.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The former are realized for 0 < n < 1 while the latter appears at half-filling with spin degeneracy lifted.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition to these ordered states we also observe an exotic state where electrons form pairs without any net charge.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This paired state can be regarded as a precursor of superconductivity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we discuss possible experimental realizations for our results.

 Introduction:-In recent years much attention has become paid to the physics of low dimensional systems such as carbon nanotubes [1] , semiconductor nanowires [2] , quantum wires [3] etc.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These materials have attracted considerable interest as they provide us with unique opportunities to explore novel physical properties which cannot exist in conventional three-dimensional bulk materials [4] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In example, it is predicted theoretically [5] or observed experimentally

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [6] that carbon nanotubes show metallic behavior even though their diameter is comparable or smaller than the Fermi wavelength.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Another interesting feature of low dimensional systems is that various kinds of electronic phases may appear due to strong correlation effects

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 One of the most important issues in this field is how to control the electronic phase diagram of low dimensional systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It should be noted here that the electronic structure strongly depends not only on the geometry but also on the chemical composition [9] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Therefore, if we could change the chemical composition of low dimensional systems, then we would expect new electronic phases to emerge.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Recently, several groups succeeded in synthesizing low dimensional compounds whose chemical compositions are controlled precisely [10 -12] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As a result, many fascinating phenomena have be discovered [13 -19] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present an optical and infrared study of the central region of the open cluster Sigma Orionis (Orion Nebula Cluster).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We have obtained deep JHK photometry with ISAAC at ESO/VLT, as well as X-ray data using XMM-Newton for a sample of stars within a radius of 1 arcmin around the Trapezium OB association.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The main results were summarized below:  - A total number of 16 new spectroscopic binaries were found among our targets.  -

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 From the analysis of the radial velocities we find that most of these systems show orbital periods longer than 100 days.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 - We also report upon the discovery of two new pre-main sequence eclipsing binary candidates.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 With addition to this, we confirm the existence of several known spectroscopic binaries in the field studied here.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we discuss some interesting cases where the presence of circumstellar disks is inferred by their IR excess emission or by periodic variability.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present new observations of the outflow driven by the young star cluster NGC 1333 IRAS 4A, located at the center of the Perseus molecular cloud (d = 235 pc).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The data were obtained with the Submillimeter Array and include continuum emission at 1.3 mm as well as CO(2-1) line emission.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that the outflow is highly collimated along an axis oriented NNE-SSW, which coincides with the direction to the nearby Herbig-Haro objects HH 7-11.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The total mass of the outflowing gas was estimated to be ~0.1 Msun, while its kinetic energy amounts to ~10^50 ergs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These values are comparable to those found for other low-mass protostellar systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, we also detect significant differences between this system and others previously studied.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, our results suggest that the outflow may have been triggered recently due to the interaction of the central source with another object or structure within the dense core surrounding it.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present the results of an investigation into the evolution of dark matter halos and their substructure, using high-resolution cosmological N-body simulations with different mass resolutions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that the number density profiles in subhalos is well described by a power law at all redshifts z < 5 for both low-mass (10^9 Msun/h) and high-mass (10^12 Msun/h) halos.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The slope of this profile is independent of halo mass but depends on redshift; it steepens as time progresses.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This behavior can be understood if we assume that the subhalo population consists of two components: one which follows the host's potential closely and another whose orbits have been significantly affected by dynamical friction.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, we show that the fraction of subhalos within r200c decreases rapidly towards higher masses.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we demonstrate how our findings can be used to quantify the effect of numerical resolution on the abundance of subhalos.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present new observations made with the Cosmosoma experiment, which is designed to search for evidence of an excess in cosmic microwave background (CMB) temperature fluctuations above those predicted by standard cosmological models.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The data are consistent with predictions based on current theoretical understanding but show some unexpected features that may be related to previously unidentified foreground sources or systematic effects associated with our analysis techniques.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We have used these results to place limits on possible contributions from primordial gravitational waves and other exotic phenomena such as topological defects.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These limits are comparable to previous measurements obtained using different experimental approaches.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition we report the detection of a significant signal at frequencies below 10GHz, which is not expected within conventional cosmological models.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This can represent either a new source of foreground contamination or a novel physical effect.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Further investigation would require additional experiments to confirm this result and determine its origin.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 If confirmed it would provide important constraints on theories attempting to explain the observed anisotropy in the CMB spectrum.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 From this work, we study the problem of how many users to turn on for multi-antenna broadcast channels (MABCs).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We first show that the optimal number of active users is equal to the rank of the channel matrix when all users have the same average signal-to-noise ratio (SNR) and there are no power constraints at the base station.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Then, under general conditions, we prove that the optimal number of users is upper bounded by the minimum between the rank of the channel and the total number of available transmit antennas.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we provide an algorithm which will find the exact solution within polynomial time complexity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The results obtained here will help us design more efficient MABC systems with reduced computational cost.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Within wireless communications, broadcasting refers to sending information simultaneously to multiple receivers over a shared medium such as radio waves or fiber optics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This type of communication has become widely used in various applications including digital television, video conferencing, data transmission, etc., where it is desirable to send messages to several users simultaneously [1] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, due to limited resources, only a subset of these users will receive useful signals while others experience interference [2] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The main challenge in designing broadcast systems lies in determining the best set of users who should be turned on so that each user receives its intended message without causing too much interference to other users

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [3] , i.e., finding the optimal user selection strategy [4] - [6] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, if one wants to maximize the sum rate of all users subject to individual power constraints, then the optimal user selection strategy depends not only on the channel state information but also on the power allocation policy [7] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Therefore, the joint optimization between user selection and power control becomes very complicated [8] .

 We present an analysis of the Swift/BAT light curve for GRB 060912, which is one of only two bursts to be get classified as both a "long-soft" (LS) and a "short-hard" (SH) event by the BAT team.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that this classification is not robust against changes in the background model used or variations in the time binning applied; we also show that it does not hold up when compared with other LS events observed by Swift.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, we demonstrate that the spectral evolution seen during the prompt phase cannot been explained within either the SH or LS models.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we argue that the most likely explanation for these observations is that GRB 060912 was actually a single pulse lasting several hundred seconds, rather than being composed of multiple pulses separated by quiescent intervals.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The results presented here suggest that there may exist a continuum of properties between the classes of long-short gamma-ray bursts currently defined by the BAT team.

 We present an analysis of the worst-case time complexity for inserting n elements into a binary search tree using the Fibonacci-heap data structure, which was based on the so-called "Young-Fibonacci insertions".

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that this algorithm has O(n log n) worst-case running time and thus improves on previous results of Chan et al., who showed that it takes at least Ω(n2/3) time to perform these operations in the worst case.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The main idea behind our proof is to use amortized analysis techniques to bound the number of times we have to update the heap's size during each step of the algorithm.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This allows us to prove that the total cost incurred over all steps are bounded by O(n log n).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, we also provide experimental evidence showing that our theoretical bounds are tight up to constant factors.

 Introduction  The Fibonacci-heap data type is introduced by Fredman and Tarjan

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [FT86] as part of their work on efficient algorithms for finding minimum spanning trees (MSTs), shortest paths, and other related problems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It consists of a rooted binary tree with two additional fields associated with every node: its parent pointer and its rank value.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Every node stores pointers to its left child and right child nodes; however, unlike ordinary binary trees, there can be more than one node with the same key stored under any given node.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Each node maintains a counter called its rank, which indicates how many keys equal to or less than the key of the current node exist below it; if no such key exists then the rank field contains zero.

 Finally, a 20 nm thick GaAs capping layer is deposited.

 The sample structure was shown schematically in Figure 1 .

 The photoluminescence spectrum shows emission peaks centered around 1280 nm corresponding to ground state excitonic transitions of individual QDs as well as higher energy states associated with charged excitons.

 We investigated the dominant aerosol processes in the atmosphere using ground-based remote sensing and chemical analysis data collected at Kashiwa, Chiba Prefecture (Chiba), Japan, between September 2009 and March 2010 under severe air pollution conditions caused by anthropogenic emissions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The results showed that sulfate particles are mainly produced through gas-to-particle conversion via homogeneous nucleation on days with low relative humidity (RH) values; however, they are also formed as secondary organic aerosols (SOAs) when RH was higher than 80%.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 On some polluted days, SOAs accounted for more than 50% of total submicron particulate matter mass concentrations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 With addition to these two major sources, aged sea salt particles contributed significantly to PM2.5 mass concentration levels.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We found that SOA formation occurred frequently throughout this study period because of frequent stagnant meteorological conditions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These findings suggest that both primary and secondary aerosol production should been considered simultaneously if we are to accurately assess atmospheric aerosol properties and their effects on human health.

 We present an analysis of galaxy clusters selected by their red-sequence galaxies (Gladders & Yee 2005) from the Sloan Digital Sky Survey Data Release 4 (DR4).

 We use two different methods to select cluster candidates, and then apply photometric redshift cuts to these samples to obtain final catalogues with high purity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The first method was based on the matched filter technique developed for X-ray surveys (Postman et al 1996) , while the second one uses a friends-of-friends algorithm applied directly to the galaxy distribution.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In order to test our selection algorithms we compare them against mock galaxy clusters extracted from N-body simulations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our main results are the follows:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This value agrees well to previous determinations using other techniques.

 We show that the non-Gaussian distributions observed in financial returns are due to microscopic interactions between traders and their environment, which lead to non-trivial correlations among different time scales.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present an analytical model for these correlations based on random matrix theory (RMT), which is able to reproduce all statistical properties of real market data with high accuracy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The distribution of stock prices has become studied extensively over many decades [1] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It is found that this distribution can be well approximated by a Gaussian function [2] , but deviations have also been reported [3] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, it has been shown recently [4] that the tails of the return distribution follow a power law decay P(r) ~ r−α with α = 3 ± 0.1.

 This finding contradicts the predictions from standard models such as Black-Scholes [5] or Heston

 [6] , where the tail exponent will be equal to 2 [7, 8] .

 RMT describes the statistics in complex systems whose dynamics depend on a large number N of degrees of freedom [10] .

 For example, RMT has successfully be applied to describe the fluctuations of energy levels [11] , wave functions

 [12] , spin states

 [14] , and chaotic scattering [15] .

 [23] , which describes the evolution of a system under the influence of white noise.

 We present the results from our numerical simulations for magnetized accretion disks in which we solve the mean-field magnetohydrodynamic equations for an axisymmetric disk with a prescribed radial distribution of angular momentum and mass fluxes, using the shearing-box approximation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that the magnetic field was amplified by differential rotation to produce large-scale poloidal fields whose strength increases outward as $(r^{-3/2})$ (where $r$ is the radius).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The toroidal component of the magnetic field also grows rapidly due to winding up of the poloidal field lines by shear flows.

 As a result, the plasma beta parameter decreases inwardly toward the central object.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, we find that the Maxwell stress associated with the magnetic field causes significant redistribution of angular momentum within the disk.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This leads to enhanced transport of angular momentum outwards across the disk surface compared to viscous stresses alone.

 [2] , massive MIMO [3] -

 [7] has attracted much attention recently.

 [8] - [10] provide significant advantages including improved coverage area, enhanced capacity, reduced power consumption, and increased network flexibility [11] .

 However, DAs also introduce new challenges due to the fact that they operate under non-coherent conditions [12] .

 For example, the channel state information (CSI) at the transmitter side cannot be obtained directly through uplink training or downlink feedback [13] .

 [18] - [20] to identify the number in active users per cell.

 The production of light elements in the early universe is one of the most important unsolved problems in astrophysics, cosmology, nuclear physics and particle physics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The standard model (SM) of elementary particles cannot explain how these elements are created during the first few minutes after the Big Bang.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this talk I will present an overview on our current understanding about the origin of light nuclei with A=1-3 produced by photonuclear reactions at high temperatures and densities in the early universe.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This includes theoretical predictions for the abundances as well as experimental results obtained using radioactive beams at GSI Darmstadt.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, I would discuss possible future experiments to test some of the key predictions made within the SM.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Keywords: Photonuclear reaction, Light element synthesis, Big Bang nucleosynthesis, Astrophysical SNe Ia explosion mechanism, Nuclear structure theory.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Light element synthesis in the early universe is among the most challenging open questions in modern science

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It was was known since the 1960s that photons can induce nuclear fusion processes leading to the creation of light elements like D, 3 He, 4 He, 7 Li or 9 Be [2] , but it was not until recently when we have gained sufficient knowledge about the physical conditions prevailing in the early universe [3] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, the temperature T and density ρ reached values up to 10 12 K and 10 15 g/cm 3 respectively

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These extreme conditions are only accessible today in laboratory experiments using relativistic heavy-ion collisions [5] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, due to the extremely short time scales involved [6] , such experiments do not allow us to study the formation of light elements directly [7, 8] .

 For nearby source models we show that this suppression leads to an upper limit on the photon fraction fγ < 10% − 20% depending on the UHECR injection spectrum assumed.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This constraint is consistent between current measurements of the diffuse gamma-ray background as well as recent results obtained using Fermi/LAT data.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, our analysis shows that cascade photons are likely to dominate the total diffuse gammaray emission below 1 GeV if they originate within a distance of about 100 Mpc around us.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present an algorithm for generating new solutions to the coupled Einstein-scalar field equations, starting from vacuum solutions and adding scalar fields in such a way that the resulting solution becomes minimally coupled.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The method can be used to generate exact solutions which are not known explicitly or only implicitly as functions of some parameters (e.g., by solving algebraic equations).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We illustrate our approach on several examples including Schwarzschild-de Sitter black holes, Reissner-Nordström-anti-de Sitter black holes, Kerr-Newman-AdS black holes, and charged dilatonic black holes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular we show how one may obtain explicit expressions for the massless limit of these black hole solutions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results may also have applications beyond gravity theory, e.g., in quantum mechanics where they could provide insight into the structure of bound states.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Introduction: Exact solutions play an important role in theoretical physics as they allow us to test various physical ideas against concrete predictions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, finding exact solutions of physically interesting problems often turns out to be very difficult.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, it took more than 100 years after the discovery of general relativity before the first exact black hole solutions was found [1-3].

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Even today there exist many open questions about black holes [4] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 One reason why finding exact solutions is so challenging is that most theories of interest do not admit any simple analytic solutions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Another problem arises when trying to find solutions describing systems with multiple interacting components like black holes surrounded by matter or other fields.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here one usually has to solve complicated differential equations numerically which makes it hard to find all possible solutions even if their existence is guaranteed theoretically.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This situation becomes particularly severe if one wants to study phenomena at strong coupling since then numerical methods become less reliable due to large corrections arising from higher orders in perturbation theory.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We study the statistical properties of Barkhausen noise generated by an Ising spin system with random fields and competing interactions at its surface, using wavelets to analyze the time series produced by this model.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that the power spectrum of the Barkhausen signal becomes well described by a stretched exponential function over several decades in frequency space.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The stretching exponent depends on both temperature T and magnetic field H. In particular, we show how the stretching exponent can be used as a measure of the degree of disorder in the sample under investigation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we discuss possible extensions to our work to other types of systems exhibiting avalanche dynamics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Barkhausen noise (BN) has been studied extensively since it was first observed experimentally more than 100 years ago [1] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It consists of bursts of magnetization reversals which occur when a ferromagnetic material was driven through successive metastable states

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [2] , and is believed to play an important role in determining the coercive force of such materials [3] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The statistics of BN have attracted considerable interest recently [4] -

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [8] due to their potential application in non-destructive testing [9] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, despite many experimental studies [10] - [12] there are still open questions about the origin of these fluctuations [13] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, while some authors claim that they arise from thermally activated processes [14] others argue that they result from collective effects [15] or even quantum tunneling [16] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A number of theoretical models [17] - [20] have also been proposed to explain the physics behind BN but none of them seems able to reproduce all features simultaneously [21] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present new results of the asteroseismic analysis of the primary component in the binary system Alpha Centari, based on data obtained with the HARPS spectrograph at La Silla Observatory (Chile).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find evidence for two independent frequencies that are likely to be associated with rotationally split modes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The observed frequency pattern is consistent to theoretical predictions and suggests an inclination angle between 40°and 60°for this star.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Keywords: Asteroseismology, Rotation, Binary stars, Oscillations, Frequency analysis, High-precision radial velocities, Alpha Centari ABSTRACT     We report new results from the asterioseismic analysis for the main-sequence F-type star Alpha Centari A, which forms part of a close double system with its cooler companion B.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our study was carried out using high-precision radial-velocity measurements collected over more than four years by the HARPS instrument installed at ESO's 3.6-m telescope at La Silla Observatory (Chilean Andes), together with photometric observations made simultaneously with the CoRoT space mission.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 By applying standard techniques used in asteroseismology we had detected several periodicities in both datasets, including one signal whose periodicity corresponds exactly to the orbital period of the system.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This finding confirms previous suggestions that the pulsational behaviour of this star may been influenced by tidal effects induced by its companion.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 By addition, our analysis reveals another set of signals corresponding to periods ranging from about 1 day up to almost 2 days.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These signals can been explained as being due to rotationally split p-mode oscillations excited in the convective envelope of the star.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Their presence provides strong support for the hypothesis that the surface of Alpha Centari A has been shaped by magnetic activity driven by dynamo processes operating within the convection zone.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present simultaneous observations with the Rossi X-ray Timing Explorer (RXTE) Proportional Counter Array, Swift Burst Alert Telescope (BAT), X-Ray Telescope (XRT), Ultraviolet/Optical Telescope (UVOT), and Radio Extension for Multi-wavelengths Observatory (REM).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The data were obtained during an active state of the source on February 18-20, 2005 .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that the spectral energy distribution is consistent with synchrotron self-Compton emission from relativistic electrons accelerated by magnetic reconnection events occurring within the jet.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This interpretation was supported by the detection of rapid variability at all wavelengths observed simultaneously.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition to this flaring activity we also detect significant flux variations over longer timescales which are likely due to changes in the Doppler boosting factor caused by bulk motion of plasma along the jet.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results demonstrate how multi-wavelength campaigns can be used to study the physical processes responsible for the production of non-thermal radiation in AGN jets.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Quantum repeaters were proposed to overcome the loss in quantum communication channels by using entangled photons and linear optics elements such as beam splitters, phase shifters, and single-photon detectors.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 From this work we present an experimental demonstration of a quantum repeater with two distant nodes connected via a 50 km fiber link.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The system consists in three parts: (1) generation, (2) transmission, and (3) detection of photon pairs from each node; (4) Bell-state measurement between the two nodes; and (5) feed-forward operation on the received qubits based on the result of Bell-state measurement.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We had successfully demonstrated all these parts except the feed-forward operation which is currently under development.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results show that our current setup can generate high quality entanglement over a distance up to 50 km.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This experiment paves the way for practical implementation of quantum networks.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Quantum repeaters are proposed to solve the problem caused by channel losses in quantum communication systems

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 They use entangled photons generated locally or remotely [2] , and linear optical elements such a beam splitters; phase shifters; and single-photon detectors [3] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 With this Letter, we report an experimental demonstration of a long-distance quantum repeater

 [4] consisting of four main components: (1) generation, ( 2 ) t r ansmission , ( 3 ) d etection , and ( 4 ) B ell

 A pair of polarization-entangled photons are produced through spontaneous parametric down-conversion (SPDC).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 One photon acted as signal while another one served as idler.

 After passing through different paths, they are combined together at a beam splitter (BS) and sent into a 50-km-long fiber-optic line.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We study the elasticity of thin films with periodic microstructure, which are constrained to lie on an underlying substrate.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that such systems can exhibit anomalously large values for their Young's moduli as well as Poisson ratios.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The origin of these effects is traced back to the presence of phonon soft modes associated with the periodicity along the film normal direction.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results have implications for the design of novel materials with tailored elastic properties.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In recent years there has been growing interest in understanding how confinement affects the physical behavior of matter at the nanoscale

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This problem arises naturally when considering thin films or nanowires embedded within bulk materials; however it also applies more generally whenever a system was restricted to occupy only part of its available phase space

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, this situation occurs frequently during crystal growth where defects may become introduced into the lattice structure by impurities [3] , or when studying colloidal suspensions [4] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work we consider the case of a thin film with periodic microstructure, whose thickness h lies between two length scales L and d (see Fig 1) .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here L represents the typical size of the unit cell while d denotes the characteristic spacing between adjacent layers; both quantities were assumed to be much smaller than the in-plane dimensions of the sample.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Such structures arise commonly from nature, e.g., in layered compounds like graphite

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [5] , transition metal dichalcogenides

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [6] , the hexagonal boron nitride

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 They are also used extensively in technological applications ranging from photovoltaics [8] to optoelectronics [9] .
