 Figure 1: Schematic illustration for our model geometry.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A thin film with periodic microstructures are confined to lie on top of a rigid substrate.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this talk, we will discuss the relationship between loop spaces and Langlands parameters in terms of their connections to representation theory.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We can begin by recalling some basic facts about loop spaces and their relation with infinite-dimensional Lie groups (e.g., loop groups).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Next, we'll recall how one might associate a certain type of infinite-dimensional Lie group called an affine Hecke algebra to any reductive algebraic group over a field k of characteristic 0.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we'll explain how these two ideas are related via the notion of a Harish-Chandra bimodule.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The main result is because if G is a connected semisimple complex algebraic group defined over Q then there exists a natural isomorphism between the category of finite-dimensional representations of G(Q) and the category of Harish-Chandra modules for its associated affine Hecke algebra.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This work is done jointly with David Vogan at Harvard University during my postdoctoral fellowship.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The Large Area Telescope (LAT) is one among two instruments aboard NASA's Fermi Gamma-ray Space Telescope, launched in June 2008.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The LAT consists in an array of silicon strip trackers and cesium iodide calorimeters that detect gamma rays with energies between 20 MeV to more than 300 GeV.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This document describes a novel method used by the LAT collaboration to monitor the performance of its detector system during flight using cosmic ray data taken over several months prior to launch.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show how this method can be applied to characterize the response function of each individual tracker module as well as the overall energy resolution of the entire LAT.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results are compared against ground calibration measurements performed before launch.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally we demonstrate how these techniques have been successfully employed to identify problems with some modules after launch which were subsequently fixed through software updates.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The Large Area Telescope (L AT ) is one among two instruments flown on NASA's Fermi Gamma-Ray Space Telescope

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Launched into space in June 2008, it has detected thousands of sources of high-energy photons since then [2] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In order to perform such observations, the L AT can accurately measure the direction and energy of incoming photons.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 To accomplish this task, the L AT uses a combination between silicon strip detectors and CsI(Tl) scintillators arranged in four layers around a central tungsten converter foil [3] , see Figure 1 .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Each layer contains 16 towers, or "trajectory segments", consisting of 4 silicon strips oriented at different angles relative to the incident photon trajectory

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition there are 8 "strips" per tower located behind the silicon sensors but outside of the active volume of the calorimeter [5] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Together they form a total for 56 independent tracking channels

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We propose that the energy release process in coronal mass ejections (CMEs) is due to two different physical mechanisms, magnetic reconnection and catastrophic loss of equilibrium driven by ideal magnetohydrodynamic (MHD) instabilities.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The first mechanism releases free magnetic energy stored in the corona into kinetic energy of plasma flows during solar eruptive events such as flares or CMEs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This mechanism has been studied extensively using numerical simulations based on resistive MHD models with various levels of complexity ranging from simple two-dimensional configurations to more realistic three-dimensional ones.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work we focus our attention on the second mechanism which involves rapid conversion of magnetic field energy into thermal energy through an explosive reconfiguration of the magnetic topology.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show how this mechanism can be modeled analytically within the framework of ideal MHD theory.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results suggest the both processes are likely to operate simultaneously but at different stages of evolution of the erupting flux rope.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this article we study the structure of smooth foliations on closed manifolds, which is given by submersions whose fibers have only Morse singularities (i.e., they look like graphs over their tangent spaces).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We prove that such foliations can be approximated in the C 1 -topology by regular ones and give an explicit bound for the approximation error.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This result is used to show that any leafwise Riemannian metric on these foliations has bounded geometry.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The main tool here is the theory of harmonic maps into Hilbert spaces developed by Eells-Elworthy-Malliavin.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, we use the fact that every harmonic map into a Hilbert space is weakly conformal.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 By another application of our results, we obtain some estimates for the volume growth rate along leaves of such foliations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, using the above mentioned bounds on the approximation error, we also get lower bounds for the number of critical points of generic functions on closed manifolds.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The Very Large Array (VLA) is an array of 27 radio telescopes located in New Mexico, USA.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The VLA has been upgraded to operate at higher frequencies and with better sensitivity than ever before.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this talk I will describe how we have developed new techniques for operating the system at 74 MHz using digital beamforming technology.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This work is done as part of my PhD thesis under the supervision of Prof. David Diamond.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 My research interests are in developing software systems that can been used by astronomers to analyse data produced by large observational facilities such as the VLA.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 I am currently working towards a postdoctoral position at Harvard-Smithsonian Center for Astrophysics where I hope to continue my research into advanced signal processing algorithms for astronomy applications.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Keywords: Radio Astronomy, Digital Signal Processing, Software Engineering, Data Analysis, Beamforming Algorithms, Very Large Array, 74 MHz

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The Standard Model is of excellent agreement with all current experimental data, but it leaves many questions unanswered and fails to provide an explanation for some phenomena observed experimentally.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The muon magnetic moment anomaly provides one such example where there are significant discrepancies between theory predictions and experiment measurements that cannot be explained within the Standard Model framework.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 During this talk I will present the physics case for the new g-2 experiment at Fermilab which aims to measure the anomalous magnetic moment of the muon more accurately than ever before by using a novel technique based on laser cooling and trapping techniques developed over recent years.   .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This talk presents the physics case for the proposed new measurement of the muon's anomalous magnetic moment at Fermilab.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It describes how the use of laser cooling and trapping can lead to a dramatic improvement in precision compared to previous experiments.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A number of other topics related to the project are also discussed including the status of the R&D program towards the goal of measuring the muon magnetic moment to 0.5 parts per million accuracy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The origin for the most massive stars is still an open question in astrophysics, as well as their role in shaping galactic evolution.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this talk I will present recent results on how we can use observations to constrain theoretical models for the formation of these objects.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The first part of my talk will focus on the observational properties of young massive clusters (YMCs) that were found at high redshift z>6-7.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These YMCs have masses up to 10^8 Msun and sizes of ~1kpc.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 They appear to be very compact compared with local starburst galaxies such as Arp 220 or M82 which typically contain much less dense stellar populations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that the observed size-mass relation of these distant YMCs agrees remarkably well with predictions based on numerical simulations of turbulent gas clouds collapsing under self-gravity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This suggests that turbulence plays an important role during the early stages of cluster formation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, it remains unclear whether all massive stars form in such large clusters like those seen at high redshifts.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We report on the optical and near-infrared afterglows of the short-hard burst GRB 050802 detected by Swift/BAT on May 2nd, 2005 at 07:55:06 UT (T0).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The prompt emission was followed by an X-ray flare peaking at T0+500 s in the rest frame.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that both components are well described by power laws with decay indices α1 = 1.2 ± 0.3 for t  10 ks.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A break is observed between these two regimes around t0 + 20 ks.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 No evidence for spectral evolution or extinction has was found within each component.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results suggest that this event may be similar to GRB 021004 which also showed a double-power law behaviour but without any significant spectral evolution across the break time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This suggests that the physical mechanism responsible for the late-time steepening could be related to the one producing the early shallow decline.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Keywords: Gamma-ray burst

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present the results of a numerical study on the relaxation dynamics of an initially straight contact line in a two-dimensional geometry, which are driven by surface tension and viscous dissipation at the moving interface between liquid and gas phases.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We solve the Navier-Stokes equations in incompressible fluids with free-slip boundary conditions using a spectral element method to simulate the flow field around the evolving droplet shape.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The initial condition consists of a circular droplet sitting on top of a flat substrate that has become perturbed slightly away from its equilibrium position.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As time evolves, we observe the formation of capillary waves along the contact line as well as the development of small satellite drops near the main droplet due to pinching off events.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, we find that the contact angle decreases continuously during this process until it reaches zero degrees when the entire droplet detaches from the substrate.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we compare our simulation results against experimental data obtained from high-speed video microscopy measurements performed by other researchers.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We study the effect on rounding on the dynamics of complex networks with first-order phase transition (FPT).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that FPTs can be rounded by adding or removing nodes, which leads to an increase in the number of cooperators at equilibrium.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The results were obtained for both static and dynamic models of evolution of cooperation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, we find that the presence of FPTs is necessary but not sufficient condition for high levels of cooperation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we propose a simple strategy for finding the best possible roundings leading to maximal level of cooperation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Rounding in first-order phase transistions and optimal cooperation in scale free networks.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Through this work we investigate how the presence of first order phase transitions affects the evolution of cooperation in social dilemmas.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 First, we introduce two new concepts -the minimal and the maximal cooperative states-which describe the range of values of parameters where cooperation prevails over defection.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Then, using these definitions, we prove that any system with first order phase transition has its own unique value of parameter corresponding to the maximum fraction of cooperators.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Next, we consider the problem of optimizing cooperation in such systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 To do so, we define the concept of "rounding" of first order phase transitions, i.e., changing their shape into smooth curves without affecting the position of the point of maximum fraction of cooperators within the interval [0, 1].

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Using numerical simulations, we demonstrate that the rounding procedure increases the fraction of cooperators at equilibrium in all studied cases.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we present a method allowing one to determine the optimal rounding of given phase transition curve.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We study the fractal dimension of domain walls (DWs) in two dimensional Ising spin glasses with nearest neighbor interactions and random bonds using Monte Carlo simulations at finite temperatures.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that DWs are fractals for all values of temperature studied here, i.e., T = 0.5J/kB to 1.2J/kB where J is the strength of interaction between spins on neighboring sites.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The fractal dimensions obtained by box counting method agree well with those determined by the correlation function analysis.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition we show that the fractal dimension decreases as the temperature increases.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This result suggests that the structure of DWs becomes more complicated when the system approaches its critical point.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally it should been noted that our results can also be applied to other systems such as vortex lines in type-II superconductors or dislocation networks in crystals.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Two-dimensional Ising spin glasses have been extensively investigated both experimentally

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [1] and theoretically

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It has been shown that these models exhibit many interesting phenomena including phase transitions [3] , spin-glass states [4] , and glassy dynamics

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Throughout this work we focus on one particular aspect of the model which is the fractal nature of domain walls [6] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Domain wall refers to an interface separating different ordered phases [7, 8] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As example, in ferromagnetic materials there exist two types of domains; up and down magnetization [9] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These domains are separated by interfaces called domain walls [10] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Similarly, in antiferromagnets [11] , there exists four possible orientations of magnetic moments

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [12] ; three of them form triangular sublattices while the fourth forms a square lattice [13] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Therefore, there will be six types of domain walls [14] .

 We present new HST photometric data on halo stars in the nearby elliptical galaxy NGC 3377, obtained with the Wide Field Planetary Camera 2 (WFPC2).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The observations are made as part of program GO-8491 and consist of two exposures taken through the F606W filter at different roll angles to allow for proper sky subtraction.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We have used these images to measure magnitudes for more than 1000 candidate red giant branch (RGB) stars within an area of 1 arcmin radius centered around the galaxy's center.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These measurements were compared to those derived by Kundu & Whitmore (1998) , who observed this same field using ground-based telescopes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results show good agreement between our photometry and that presented previously; however we find evidence for systematic differences which may be due to crowding effects or calibration uncertainties.

 Keywords: Red Giant Branch, Galaxy, WFPC2

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 We present an analysis of chemical equilibrium and disequilibrium processes occurring in the atmospheres of substellar mass objects (SMBOs).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We have developed a new method for calculating departures from chemical equilibrium, which is based on the assumption that all species are in local thermodynamic equilibrium with each other at any given point within the atmosphere.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This approach allows us to calculate the abundances for individual molecular species as functions of altitude above the photosphere.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The results show that there can be significant deviations from chemical equilibrium even under conditions where the gas temperature is much higher than the dust temperature.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, we find that carbon monoxide may be depleted by several orders of magnitude relative to its abundance predicted by chemical equilibrium models.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These findings suggest that SMBO observations should take into account possible non-equilibrium effects when interpreting their spectra.

 We present an explicit criterion to determine whether or not two given multipartite quantum states are separable, i.e., can are written as convex combinations of product states.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The criterion is formulated in terms of the Bloch representation of the corresponding density matrices and it relies only on local measurements performed by each party.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that our method provides a necessary condition for separability which is strictly weaker than other known criteria.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally we illustrate its usefulness by some examples.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Recently, Vidal et al [5] introduced this new approach to study separability problems using the Bloch representation

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This technique allows one to obtain simple conditions for separability which involve only local measurements made by each party involved in the system under consideration.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, these results do not apply directly when dealing with mixed states as they require the knowledge of all possible pure-state decompositions of such states.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here we will use another version of the Bloch representation

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 Our main result consists of showing that there exists at least one decomposition into pure states compatible with the Bloch representation of every separable state.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As a consequence, we prove that the criterion presented here constitutes a necessary condition for separabilty which is strictly weaker than previous ones [8] .

 We present the first exact local solution to the equations of motion for type II B supergravity in AdS 5 × S 5 .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The solution is supported by two independent harmonic functions, one on each side of an arbitrary surface Σ which divides space into three regions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that this solution preserves eight real supercharges and has vanishing central charge.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It can be interpreted as a bound state of N = 4 SYM theory with gauge group SU(N)×SU(N), where the number of degrees of freedom scales like O(N 2 ) at large N.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition we find a new class of solutions describing interfaces between different vacua of the same field theory.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These are obtained by taking appropriate limits of our general solution.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 They preserve four supercharges and have non-vanishing central charges.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 One particular member of this family describes a supersymmetric Janus-like configuration interpolating between two distinct conformal fixed points of the same field theory.

 Introduction  The study of holographic duals of strongly coupled quantum systems has been greatly advanced over recent years through the use of string/M-theory [1, 2] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A particularly interesting application for these ideas involves studying non-conformal theories using their dual description in terms of gravitational backgrounds [3, 4] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In order to construct such models it is necessary to solve the equations for motion associated with the relevant supergravity or gauged supergravity theory.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This problem becomes more tractable when considering specific classes with solutions preserving some fraction of the original supersymmetry

 We report on Suzaku observations for four active galactic nuclei (AGNs) detected by Swift/BAT survey, which are classified as "obscured AGNs" with column density larger than 10 24 cm-2 .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We found that all these sources show strong Fe K emission lines and their line widths are broader than those expected from thermal broadening at kT = 100 keV.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The observed line profiles can be reproduced well by relativistic disk reflection models including Compton scattering effects.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results suggest that there is an additional component to the X-ray continuum other than the standard thin accretion disks around supermassive black holes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, we find that the iron abundance relative to solar value is higher than 1.5 times in three out of four objects.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This suggests that the central engines of these obscured AGNs may have been buried under heavy dusty torii.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we discuss possible origins for this new type of buried supermassive black holes based on our observational results.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present the results of our analysis of cosmic ray data collected by the PAMELA experiment in 2008 and 2009, which show an excess over background at energies between 1-10 GeV/nucleon that is consistent with being produced by particles accelerated in nearby supernova remnants (SNRs).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that this signal can be explained if we assume that SNR RX J1713-3946 accelerates protons up to 10 TeV energy per nucleon.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The observed fluxes are also compatible with those expected for other known sources such as pulsars or active galactic nuclei.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, these alternative scenarios cannot explain all features seen in the data set.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, they did not predict any significant anisotropy in arrival directions on angular scales below ~10 degrees.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This prediction was confirmed by observations made using the Tibet ASγ air shower array.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we discuss possible implications for our findings for models of particle acceleration in relativistic shocks.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The gamma ray emission in the energy range 100 MeV to 10 GeV was studied using data taken by EGRET on board CGRO during its first four years of operation (1991) (1992) (1993) (1994) .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The analysis was is performed for two different regions, one centered at l = 0° and b = - 5° , which includes the galactic centre region, and another centered at l = 180° and b = + 5° .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In both cases we have used an iterative maximum likelihood method to determine the fluxes of individual sources as well as their spectral parameters.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that there are three distinct components contributing to the observed gamma-ray flux above 1 GeV :  A diffuse component with a power law spectrum extending upto ~10 GeV .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A point source located at Sgr A* with a power law spectrum .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 An extended source near the galactic center with a broken power law spectrum .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also present results obtained when the same analysis was repeated after excluding the contribution due to the central part of the Galaxy .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We have studied the pulse-to-pulse intensity variations in two pulsars, PSR B0826-34 and PSR B1133+16, using data obtained with the Parkes radio telescope at 1.4 GHz (92cm) and 2.7GHz(36cm).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that both pulsars show strong evidence for subpulse drift bands which are modulated by an underlying pattern of weaker emission.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The observed patterns can be explained as due to interference between different modes of emission within each beam.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition we find that there is no significant difference in the subpulse modulation properties when comparing observations made at 36cm and those made at 92cm.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This suggests that the physical processes responsible for producing these phenomena operate over a wide range of frequencies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results provide further support for the idea that the phenomenon known as drifting subpulses may arise through some form of plasma instability operating on the open field lines near the magnetic poles of neutron stars.

 We present results for MHD simulations of the magneto-rotational instability (MRI) in a stratified, Keplerian disk threaded by an initially vertical magnetic field using the ZEUS-2D code.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We consider both isothermal and adiabatic equations for state to examine how the MRI depends on the thermodynamics of the gas.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In all cases we find that the growth rate of the fastest growing mode agrees well with linear theory predictions when normalized appropriately.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, there are significant differences between our runs depending upon whether or not they have reached steady-state equilibrium.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, the saturated level of stress achieved at late times varies significantly among different models.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This suggests that it may be difficult to accurately predict the saturation amplitude of the MRI unless one can perform very high resolution calculations which evolve over many orbital periods.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we show that the inclusion of radiative cooling has little effect on the properties of the turbulence generated by the MRI.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We report on the discovery of an unexpected ring-like dark matter structure at the center of galaxy cluster CL0024+17, which was located about 3 billion light years away and has been studied extensively by many observational techniques including gravitational lensing.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The mass distribution inferred from strong gravitational lensing shows that there are two massive subclusters separated by 1 Mpc (3 arcmin) with a total mass of 2 x 10 15 h-1M_sun within a radius of 0.5h-1Mpc around their centers.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that this double-cluster system can be well described as a binary merger model where each component consists of three components; one main halo and two smaller halos surrounding it.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition to these six clusters, we also detect another small clump of galaxies near the center of the merging system whose position coincides with the peak of X-ray emission detected by Chandra satellite observations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present an analysis on the distribution and properties of open clusters in the Galactic anticenter region, using data from the Two Micron All Sky Survey (2MASS).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We have compiled a list of all open clusters with angular diameters larger than 1 arcmin within a distance of 8 kpc from the Sun.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The total number is about 1000.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This sample includes most known open clusters in this part of the Galaxy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Using photometric distances derived from fitting theoretical stellar evolutionary tracks to observed color-magnitude diagrams for each cluster we construct maps showing their spatial distributions as well as their luminosity functions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results show that there are two distinct populations of open clusters: one population located at galactocentric radii between 4 and 6 kpc which has ages less than 3 Gyr; another population located at galactocenric radii greater than 7 kpc which has ages older than 5 Gyr.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present new results on the age, metallicity and alpha-element abundance for galactic globular clusters (GGCs) based on single stellar population models with different prescriptions for convection theory.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that the ages derived by using the classical mixing-length theory are systematically younger than those obtained by assuming overshooting or semiconvection in the red giant branch phase.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The difference between these two sets of ages is about 0.5 Gyr at most.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For some metal-rich GGCs, we also found that their ages inferred from the classical mixing-length theory can be as young as 10 Gyr while they should have been older than 12 Gyr according to other methods.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This discrepancy may result from the fact that the classical mixing-length theory cannot reproduce well the observed color-magnitude diagrams of such metal-rich GGCs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results show that there exists no significant correlation between the cluster's age and its metallicity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These findings suggest that the formation history of GGCs might not be dominated by monolithic collapse but instead by hierarchical merging processes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present an overview of the theory for vortices in trapped, dilute atomic gases at low temperatures.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We discuss how these systems can be described by macroscopic wave functions and show that they are governed by nonlinear Schrödinger equations with external potentials.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The solutions to this equation have been studied extensively over many years and we review some of their properties relevant to vortex formation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, we consider stationary states which correspond to condensate configurations without rotation (vortex-free) as well as rotating ones where quantized angular momentum are carried by phase singularities known as vortices.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we briefly describe recent experiments in vortex production in cold atom clouds.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Vortices occur naturally in superfluids such as liquid helium or dilute atomic gases.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 They are quantized angular momenta and play important roles in various physical phenomena including turbulence and quantum transport processes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here we give an introduction for the theoretical description of vortices in trapped atomic gases.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present deep imaging data of the nearby dwarf spheroidal galaxy, Hercules (dSph), obtained with the Large Binocular Telescope (LBT).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The new observations are used to study the structure and stellar populations in this system.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that the surface brightness profile was well described by an exponential function over most of its extent but shows evidence for a break at about 30 arcsec radius.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This feature may be associated with tidal disruption or stripping due to interactions between Hercules and other galaxies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Using colour-magnitude diagrams we show that there exists two distinct components within Hercules; one which has been stripped off and another which appears to have remained intact.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results suggest that Hercules was once more extended than it currently is today.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, using our photometric catalogue we measure the line-of-sight velocity dispersion as a function of projected distance from the centre of Hercules.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our measurements indicate that the central region of Hercules exhibits higher values compared to those measured further out.

 The concept of defects in crystals has been developed by the Russian school since the 1930s.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The main idea is that any crystal can become considered as an elastic continuum with some local deviations from its ideal structure which are called defects.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work we present a brief review on the history of the development of the theory of defects in solids.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also discuss the modern concepts for point-like defects (dislocations), line-like defects (disclinations) and continuous defects.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we give examples of how these ideas have been applied to different physical systems such as liquid crystals or magnetic materials.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Defects play an important role in many areas of physics ranging from solid state physics to condensed matter physics and even biology.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 They appear naturally in phase transitions between ordered states like those occurring at melting points or critical temperatures.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, they may lead to plastic deformations in metals or glassy materials.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In the other hand, defects are responsible for macroscopic properties of solids like electrical conductivity or magnetization.

 We present an algorithm that systematically scans all possible 7-colourings of the grid, and report on its performance in terms of running time and memory consumption.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The algorithm was based on a simple backtracking scheme combined with some heuristics to prune parts of the search space.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We have implemented this algorithm using Java 1.6 and tested it on several instances ranging from small grids up to large ones containing more than one million nodes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For each instance we provide detailed information about how much time is spent by our program during colouring as well as how many colours were used.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, we also show how these results compare against those obtained by other algorithms proposed recently in the literature.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this talk I will discuss how these signatures can get searched for using data collected by the ATLAS experiment during Run 1 of the LHC.

 The results are presented both in terms of limits on production cross sections and mass exclusion regions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular we show that BBN can be compatible with an unstable tau-neutrino mass as large as mtau = 1 TeV even when its decay rate is suppressed by a factor of 10^{10} compared to the Standard Model prediction.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This result has important implications in models of leptogenesis which require heavy Majorana masses for right-handed neutrinos.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The possibility that such light unstable particles also opens up new avenues for probing physics beyond the Standard Model at future colliders like LHC or ILC.

 The discovery that the universe is expanding at an accelerating rate has led to intense interest in dark energy as well as new ideas about fundamental physics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This talk would review some recent results on these topics including constraints on models for cosmic acceleration using supernovae data, measurements of the Hubble constant with Type Ia supernovae, and tests of general relativity using gravitational lensing statistics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The talk will also discuss how future surveys such as LSST can be used to further our understanding of dark energy and fundamental physics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 I will conclude by discussing my own work on testing gravity theories beyond Einstein's theory using weak lensing observations.

 We also implemented a web interface so that users can view the results obtained from our analysis.

 We study the entanglement of two atoms trapped inside an optical cavity, each interacting with one mode of the electromagnetic field.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The results are obtained by solving numerically the Schrödinger equation describing the evolution of the system.

 We show that the interface is described by a chordal Schramm-Löwner evolution if the underlying lattice has no loops or multiple edges; otherwise it is described by a radial Schramm-Löwner evolutions.

 We present the results of an X-ray study of supernova remnant (SNR) G299.2-2.9 using data obtained with Chandra and XMM-Newton observatories.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The SNR is located in the constellation Puppis at a distance of ~5 kpc, which corresponds to its angular size of about 30 arcmin.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that the spectrum of this object can been described by two thermal components with temperatures T1=7×10^6 K and T2=2×10^6 K.

 In addition, we detect non-thermal emission above 10 keV. Using these parameters, we estimate the age of the SNR as t=4000 yr.

 This value agrees well to the characteristic time for the expansion of the shell into the surrounding medium.

 Based on our analysis, we conclude that the observed morphology of the SNR is consistent with the model of a spherical explosion expanding into a uniform interstellar medium.

 The design and kinematics analysis of parallel kinematic machine tools (PKMTs) are presented in this work using kinetic-static performance criteria.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The proposed approach considers the dynamic behavior of PKMTs during their operation, which has remained neglected by previous works on PKMTs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition to the static stiffness matrix, the inertia properties are also considered for the evaluation of the overall dynamic response of PKMTs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A new method based on the concept of virtual joints is developed to calculate the mass distribution along each leg of the PKMT under consideration.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This information can be used as an input data set for further dynamic analyses such as modal or harmonic vibration analysis.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It was found that the first PKMT exhibits better dynamic characteristics than its counterpart due to its lower natural frequencies and higher damping ratios.

 The geochemical behavior of uranium (U) and thorium (Th), which are radioactive elements, is discussed in relation to their influence on the origin and evolution of the crust of earth as well as biological evolution.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The chemical properties of these two elements are similar; however, they have different physical characteristics that affect how they behave geologically.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Uranium has an atomic number of 92 with a half-life of 4.5 billion years while thorium has an atomic number of 90 with a half life of 1.4 billion years.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Both elements occur naturally in the Earth's crust but at varying concentrations depending upon the rock type.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 They can be found in igneous rocks such as granite or basalt where they form minerals like uranite or thorite respectively.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These minerals may also contain other trace metals like lead, silver, gold, copper, zinc, arsenic, selenium, molybdenum, cadmium, mercury, bismuth, antimony, tellurium, cobalt, nickel, manganese, iron, vanadium, chromium, tungsten, titanium, zirconium, niobium, tantalum, hafnium, rhenium, osmium, iridium, platinum, palladium, rhodium, ruthenium, and iridium.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Uranium and thorium are also present in sedimentary rocks such as sandstone, shale, limestone, dolomite, gypsum, anhydrite, salt beds, and evaporites.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Sedimentary rocks were formed by weathering processes when water erodes.

 The response prediction for structural system subject to earthquake motions is very important for the design and construction of buildings in seismic areas, especially when it comes to high-rise building structures.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this study, an artificial neural network (ANN) model is developed by using data obtained through nonlinear dynamic analysis on reinforced concrete frame structure subjected to earthquake ground motion records.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The ANN model consists in three layers; input layer, hidden layer with 10 neurons, output layer with one neuron representing maximum inter-story drift ratio.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Input variables used are peak ground acceleration, duration time, number of stories, story height, mass density of unit floor area, damping coefficient, yield strength of steel bar, elastic modulus of steel bar, shear wall stiffness, and moment capacity of beam-column joint.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 To verify the accuracy of the proposed ANN model, results predicted by the ANN are compared with those calculated by nonlinear dynamic analysis program.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It can be concluded that the ANN model has good performance in predicting the maximum inter-story drift ratios under various earthquake ground motions.

 The NC size is varied between 1 nm to 5 nm with an interval of 0.5 nm.

 We show how these solutions were related to each other by using approximate analytic methods.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Within this work, we also discuss the possibility of formation of such objects through mergers between smaller clusters or stars.

 Super massive star clusters (SMCs), known as young globular clusters (YGCs), open clusters (OCs), compact elliptical galaxies (CEGs), etc., is observed in many galactic systems ranging from dwarf irregular galaxies to giant ellipticals.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These objects were believed to form during violent events like galaxy mergers, tidal interactions, and/or gas-rich major mergers.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, it has been shown recently that there exists another class of SMCs whose luminosity function shows a peak at intermediate masses (10^6-10^7 Msun).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This type of cluster are referred to as "Intermediate Massive Clusters"(IMCs; Portegies Zwart et al. (2010)).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It appears that IMCs may represent a transition phase between open clusters and YGCs.

 We present an analysis of the temperature dependence of thermally stimulated luminescent (TSL) glow curves in terms of the nonstationary electron-phonon relaxation theory, which does not assume whether the system is close to equilibrium at any time during its evolution.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show how this approach can been used for extracting information about the phonon spectrum and the density of states of charge carriers from TSL data obtained on different types of materials.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The results are compared with those obtained by other methods such as photoluminescence excitation spectroscopy or Raman scattering.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular we demonstrate that our method allows one to determine the energy gap between the conduction band minimum and valence band maximum in semiconductors.

 The study of luminescence phenomena has been attracting considerable attention over many years as it provides valuable information about electronic structure and optical properties of solids

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Thermal stimulation luminescence (TSL), also known as optically stimulated luminescence (OSL), is particularly useful as it enables us to probe the distribution function of electrons excited into the conduction band

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In recent decades there have been numerous attempts to develop theoretical models describing various aspects of luminescence processes [3] , including thermal stimulation luminescence

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, most of these works were based on the assumption that the system under consideration is always close to equilibrium

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As a result they cannot describe correctly some important features observed experimentally

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, the shape of the TSL glow curve depends strongly on the type of material [11] : while in insulators it usually exhibits a single peak [12] , in metals it often consists of several peaks [13] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Moreover, even within the same class of materials, e.g., semiconductor crystals [14] , the number of peaks can vary depending on the doping level [15] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These observations cannot been explained using existing theories

 We introduce the notion for intersection bodies in arbitrary dimensions, generalizing the classical concept for dimension two to higher dimensions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that intersection bodies is characterized by their Fourier transforms which we call generalized cosine transforms (GCT).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The GCTs can be used as an alternative tool to study intersection bodies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, we prove that intersection bodies have positive volume if and only if they are convex.

 This was done using a new characterization of intersection bodies via their support functions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 From this work, we study the problem of clustering co-occurrences of maximal frequent patterns (MFP) in streams.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We propose an algorithm that clusters MFPs depending on their occurrences and then uses these clusters to build a compact representation for each pattern.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The proposed approach is efficient both in terms of space consumption as well as time required to process new data points.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our experimental results show that our method outperforms state-of-the-art algorithms by up to two orders of magnitude while achieving high accuracy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, it can be easily parallelized using existing frameworks such as MapReduce or Spark.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Keywords: Data stream mining, Cluster analysis, Frequent itemset mining, Association rule learning, Time series prediction.

 Introduction Mining large volumes of streaming data has become increasingly important over recent years due to its wide range of applications including sensor networks [20, 21] , social media analytics

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [22] , fraud detection

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [23] , network intrusion detection [24] , etc.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, processing massive amounts of streaming data poses several challenges since traditional batch-based approaches are not applicable anymore [25] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, if one wants to detect anomalies in a continuous flow of tweets, he needs to continuously monitor all incoming messages and identify those which deviate significantly from normal behavior [26] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 To address these issues, researchers have developed various techniques for analyzing data streams [7, 8, 27 ].

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 An emerging area within data stream mining focuses on discovering interesting patterns from data streams [28] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A common task in this context is finding frequent items/patterns in data streams [29] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Another popular research direction involves identifying correlations among different attributes [30] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These tasks are often performed jointly with classification

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [31] and/or regression [32] problems.

 We present the results of an extensive study of gas dynamics, star formation activity, dust extinction, stellar populations, and black hole accretion properties for a strongly lensed galaxy (A1689-zD1) at redshift 3.07.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The lensing magnification factor is ~30Â±5.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We use deep near-infrared spectroscopy to measure the kinematics in molecular hydrogen emission lines with high spatial resolution.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our observations reveal that this system consists of two merging galaxies separated by 1 kpc along the line-of-sight.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 One of these components shows strong HÎ² emission indicative of active galactic nuclei (AGN).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This AGN component has a mass of âˆ¼10^9 M_sol , which corresponds to a supermassive black hole with a mass of âˆ½â€“1 Ã— 10^8 M_sol .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Using our spatially resolved measurements we find evidence of intense nuclear starbursts on scales as small as 100 pc.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The ultimate fate of the universe is one of the most important questions in physics and cosmology today, but it has been difficult to answer because quantum mechanics (QM) cannot been applied directly to macroscopic systems such as the whole universe.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this talk I will present an approach that allows us to use QM to study the evolution of the universe on all scales by applying it only to small subsystems within the universe.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This method can also be used to calculate the probability distribution for the time at which the universe ends its existence.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The results are consistent with current observations and provide new insights into how the universe might end up.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, we find that there is a finite probability that the universe will expand forever without ever ending or collapsing.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also show that if the universe does collapse then it must do so before 10^(10^28) years have passed since the Big Bang.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we discuss some possible implications from these results for the future of humanity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We study the evolution in cosmic strings in an expanding universe, focusing on their formation mechanism and subsequent growth.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that cosmic strings can form when magnetic fields are trapped inside overdense regions during inflation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The resulting network consists in many small loops which evolve into larger ones through gravitational radiation emission.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This process is similar as the one proposed for electroweak strings formed at phase transitions after inflation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, we find that the loop distribution function has a different shape than previously assumed.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, it contains more large loops with sizes comparable to the Hubble radius today.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These loops can be detectable as stochastic backgrounds of gravitational waves or gamma rays.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Cosmic strings have been predicted to exist since the early 1980s

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 They could arise naturally if there were extra dimensions beyond those observed so far [3] , or they might be produced at symmetry breaking phase transitions [4] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Cosmic strings can produce observable effects such as gravitational lensing [5] , CMB anisotropies

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [6] , and primordial black holes [7, 8] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Despite this interest, no direct detection of cosmic strings has yet be made [9] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 One reason why cosmic strings remain elusive is because they are expected to be very light (with masses less than $10^{-16}eV$)

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Another problem is that cosmic strings are not stable objects but rather decay rapidly via gravitational radiation

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Therefore, any observational evidence will come indirectly from the products of cosmic string decays [12] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In order to make predictions about possible observations, cosmological simulations need to be performed [13] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A number of groups have studied cosmic string networks using N-body codes

 We consider the effective inverse spectral problems (EISP) associated with rational Lax matrices, which are generalizations of classical EISP in terms of Jacobi matrices.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that these new EISPs can get reduced to some special cases of classical EISP by using an explicit formula for the coefficients of the characteristic polynomial of a rational matrix.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As examples we study two classes of rational Lax matrices: one is related to the Toda lattice hierarchy and another is connected with the modified Volterra lattice hierarchy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For particular, we give a complete description on all solutions of the corresponding EISPs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, as applications of our results, we present several interesting properties about the spectra of these rational Lax matrices.

 The research was supported by NSFC under Grant No.11571040.

 We report on the detection by Swift/BAT and Konus-Wind of gamma-ray burst (GRB) 060927, which is one of only two events detected with redshifts greater than five to date.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The redshift was determined using optical spectroscopy obtained with the Very Large Telescope in Chile within three hours after the burst trigger time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that this event has an extremely hard spectrum, similar to other high-redshift bursts observed previously.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Using our current understanding of the physics behind these phenomena we could estimate the total energy released during the prompt emission phase of the burst to be ~10^53 erg.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This value is comparable to or larger than the energies released by some supernovae.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 If confirmed, it would make GRB 060927 the most energetic event ever recorded.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, if the host galaxy mass function evolves similarly to what is seen locally, then the progenitor system responsible for producing such an energetic explosion must have been hosted by a very massive galaxy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results are consistent with theoretical predictions made about the progenitors of high-z GRBs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we discuss how future observations of this object will help us understand the end of cosmic reionization.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We report on the first simultaneous infrared (IR) and X-ray observations of Sgr A*, made with the Chandra X-Ray Observatory and the Spitzer Space Telescope in 2007-2008.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that the IR emission is consistent with being produced by dust heated to temperatures between 100 K and 1000 K; this temperature range corresponds to an observed flux density at 8 microns ranging from 0.1 mJy to 1 Jy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The spectral index of the IR emission did not change significantly during these variations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This result suggests that the physical conditions within the emitting region are relatively constant over time scales as short as one month.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results also suggest that the IR emission may be dominated by optically thin thermal bremsstrahlung rather than synchrotron radiation.

 Keywords: black hole physics, infrared astronomy, radio source variability, space telescopes, X-ray astronomy         Black holes have been predicted to produce intense electromagnetic fields near their event horizons.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, direct observational evidence have remained elusive because of the extreme environment surrounding such objects.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 One possible way to detect such fields could be through the detection of polarized light emitted close to the horizon.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Another possibility involves detecting changes in the spectrum or intensity of the accretion flow onto the black hole itself.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Such changes could occur if the magnetic field lines threading the disk were twisted into helical shapes due to differential rotation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 If so, they can act like antennae which amplify any incoming waves along them.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 As a consequence, the local plasma frequency will increase, causing the plasma to become more opaque to lower-frequency waves but less opaque to higher frequencies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Thus, we expect the spectrum of the emission to steepen toward longer wavelengths when the system becomes brighter.

 We study the problem of finding an optimal schedule for data transmission over multiple channels with interference constraints, where each channel is assigned to one transmitter-receiver pair and transmissions on different pairs are subject to mutual interference.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We consider two models: (i)

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The first model assumes that all transmitters have fixed power levels.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 (ii) In the second model we assume that transmitters can adjust their powers dynamically.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In both cases, we show how to find an optimal schedule by solving a sequence of linear programs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results hold even if there exists only one receiver per transmitter.

 Each node has limited range and thus cannot communicate directly with every other node.

 Instead, it communicates indirectly through intermediate nodes called relays or routers.

 We have studied by means of molecular dynamics simulations how the dynamic behavior of silver atoms deposited on gold (100) are affected when the substrate temperature and the coverage are varied in such a way that the average number of nearest neighbors per atom changes between 1 to 4.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that, for low coverages, the system behaves as if it were made up of isolated particles with no interaction among them.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, at higher coverages we observe collective effects which lead to the formation of ordered structures.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The results obtained show that these structures can been classified into two different categories depending on whether they are formed by one or more layers of silver atoms.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, we found that the structure of the first layer depends strongly on the substrate temperature while the second layer shows only small variations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, our calculations indicate that the third layer forms a disordered arrangement of silver atoms.

 This work is supported by DGESIC under project PB98-0443-C02-01

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We study the fractional charge and statistics of elementary excitations in quantum spin systems with frustration, using exact diagonalization techniques for small clusters up to 12 sites.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that the ground state is always gapped and has no degeneracy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The elementary excitations are fractionally charged fermions or bosons depending on whether the system is antiferromagnetic (AF) or ferromagnetic (F).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In AF cases we also observe neutral fermionic excitations which carry zero electric charge but have nontrivial braiding properties.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results can be understood by mapping our models onto effective lattice gauge theories where the elementary excitations correspond to particles carrying flux quanta.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our work provides an explicit example of how fractional charges emerge naturally as topological defects in strongly correlated electronic materials.

 Introduction:-The discovery of high temperature superconductivity in copper oxide compounds [1] , together with other exotic phenomena such as colossal magnetoresistance [2] , non-Fermi liquid behavior [3] etc., has led to renewed interest in understanding the physics of strongly interacting electrons.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 One of the most important open questions concerns the nature of the elementary excitations responsible for these novel behaviors [4] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It is suggested early on [5] that the elementary excitations may be described by some kind of collective modes known as spin waves [6] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However it soon became clear [7, 8] that this description fails at low energies due to strong electron correlations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 More recently there has been considerable progress towards developing theoretical descriptions based on new concepts like fractionalized quasiparticles [9] , emergent gauge fields

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [10] , the topological order [11] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, recent experiments [12] suggest that the elementary excitations in the cuprates might indeed been described by some form of fractionalized quasiparticle

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This raises many interesting questions about their physical properties including their charge [14] , statistics

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [15] , and interactions [16] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Unfortunately, after enormous efforts [17] , a complete microscopic theory describing all these aspects remains elusive [18] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Another promising approach involves studying simplified model Hamiltonians

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [19, 20] whose low-energy limit captures essential features from the original problem

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The present work is devoted to the study of photon wave mechanics in terms of position eigenvectors, which were introduced as solutions of the Schrödinger equation for photons with an arbitrary energy spectrum.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The concept of position eigenvector allows one to describe the state of a single photon by its position probability density distribution function (PDF).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It also enables us to introduce the notion of quantum trajectory describing the evolution of this PDF over time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, we show that the quantum trajectories corresponding to different initial states can be obtained from each other by means of unitary transformations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We demonstrate how these results may be used to analyze various phenomena related to the propagation of light through dispersive media.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we discuss possible applications for our approach to the description of nonclassical effects associated with the emission of entangled pairs of photons.

 We study the Catalan numbers in connection with the number of ways to realize a given triangulation as an ordered sequence of its diagonals, or equivalently, as a set of non-crossing diagonals.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that this problem is related to counting certain types of Dyck paths.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular we prove that for any positive integer n there are exactly C(n) different sequences of diagonals which can be realized by a convex quadrilateral having 2n sides.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This result generalizes a theorem due to Motzkin and Straus on the number of diagonalizations of a convex polygon.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Introduction  The Catalan numbers count many combinatorial objects such as binary trees, noncrossing partitions, spanning trees, etc., see e.g.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The present work deals in another class of Catalan-like objects: triangulations of polygons (see Figure 1 ).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A triangulation T of a simple polygon P is defined as follows: it consists of all edges of P together with some additional diagonals connecting pairs of vertices of P so that each interior angle of P becomes at least 90 degrees after adding these diagonals.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It follows immediately that every edge belongs to one and only one diagonal of T .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In [3] , Motzkin and Straus' celebrated theorem states that if D denotes the set of diagonals of a convex polygon Q then |D| = 2|Q|.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 They also proved that the number of diagonalizations d(P ) of a convex polygon P equals the number of diagonals of a triangulation of P .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It is shown recently [4] that the number of diagonals in a triangulation of a convex quadrilateral is equal to four times the number of diagonals needed to diagonalize the quadrilateral.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Thus, the following question arises naturally: What is the relationship between the number of diagonals required to diagonalize a convex quadrilateral and the number of diagonals used in a triangulation?

 We present an algorithm to construct the reduced basis space in the context of nonlinear problems with multiple solutions, which are based on the concept of quasi-equilibrium grid (QEG).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The QEG method is originally developed by Simo and Armero as a numerical technique for solving rate-independent processes such as plasticity or damage mechanics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that this approach can been used to generate snapshots for constructing the reduced basis spaces associated with nonlinear problems with multiple solutions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For particular, we consider two examples arising from structural dynamics and fluid flow computations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Numerical results demonstrate that our proposed method yields accurate approximations at significantly lower computational cost than existing approaches.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Keywords: Reduced Basis Method; Quasi-Equilibrium Grids; Nonlinear Problems; Model Order Reduction; Geometric Construction; Snapshot Generation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The goal in this work is to develop efficient algorithms for generating snapshots for constructing the RB spaces associated with nonlinear problems having multiple solutions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This problem arises frequently when one solves engineering applications involving complex physical phenomena such as multiphysics coupling, material failure, contact/impact, etc.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, in structural dynamics, it may happen that different initial conditions lead to different equilibrium states

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Similarly, in fluid flows, there are often many steady-state solutions corresponding to different boundary conditions

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For order to solve these types of problems efficiently using the reduced basis method (RBM), it is necessary to have a good set of snapshots representing all possible solution behaviors.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, because each snapshot corresponds to a specific solution behavior, it is not easy to obtain them directly through standard finite element analysis.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Therefore, various techniques have been developed over the past decade to overcome this difficulty

 We study the critical behavior in the 3D RFIM with Gaussian distributed disorder by means of Monte Carlo simulations and finite-size scaling analysis.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that the system undergoes a continuous phase transition at zero temperature, which was characterized by an infinite correlation length but no divergent susceptibility.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The results were compared to those obtained for the pure 3D Ising model as well as other models with quenched disorder.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular we show how our findings can become understood within the framework of the droplet picture.

 The Random Field Ising Model (RFIM) has been introduced more than 50 years ago [1] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It describes a ferromagnetic material where each spin interacts only with its nearest neighbors via exchange interactions J ij , while it also feels an external magnetic field

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 h i randomly oriented to different sites

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In recent years there have been many studies devoted to this problem both experimentally

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [6] and theoretically [7] -

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This interest was triggered mainly by the fact that the RFIM shares some features with real systems such as diluted antiferromagnets or spin-glasses

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, the presence of quenched disorder leads to frustration effects [16] similar to those observed in spin-glass materials [17] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Moreover, the RFIM displays a rich variety of phases depending on the strength of the applied magnetic field [18] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In low fields one finds a paramagnetic phase, whereas above a certain threshold value H c = O(J), the spins align along the direction of the local magnetic field leading to a ferromagnetic state [19] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, if the magnitude of the external field exceeds another threshold value H t > H c , the magnetization becomes discontinuous [20] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These three regimes were separated by two second-order transitions occurring at T c1  0

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, despite these analogies between the RFIM and experimental systems [22] , the exact nature of the phase diagram remains controversial [23] .

 We present an approach to self-organization in networks based on multi-agent systems (MAS).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The proposed method was applied to two different networks: one with mobile nodes and another with static ones, both using IEEE 802.11b as their communication protocol.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work we use agents that are able to move between neighboring nodes, which allows them to collect information about the state of each node.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This information can get used by other agents to make decisions such as: moving to new positions or changing the transmission power level.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We have implemented our proposal in NS-2 simulator and compared it against three well-known algorithms: OLSR, AODV and DSR.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results show that MAS outperforms these protocols in terms of: packet delivery ratio, end-to-end delay and energy consumption.

 The National Institutes of Health (NIH) is the largest funder for biomedical research in the United States, but it also supports non-biomedical research through its extramural program.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The NIH has funded thousands of scientists at hundreds of institutions across the country to conduct basic science research that may have important applications outside of medicine.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This study examines how these researchers were using their NIH funding for non-biomedical projects by analyzing data collected during interviews with them conducted as part of an ongoing longitudinal survey of NIH-funded investigators.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that many of these scientists use their NIH funds primarily or exclusively for non-biomedically related research activities such as teaching, administration, and service work.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, we also find that some scientists who receive NIH support for non-biomedics-related research still spend most of their time conducting biomedically focused research.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, our results show that scientists' perceptions about whether they are spending more time doing biomedically versus non-biomedically focused research do not always match up with actual behavior.

 We present the results on diffuse optical light (DOL) correlations with cluster properties for a sample of galaxy clusters observed by the Hubble Space Telescope Advanced Camera for Surveys and Spitzer Infrared Array Camera.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that DOL correlates positively with X-ray luminosity, temperature, mass, velocity dispersion, and Sunyaev-Zel'dovich effect flux decrement at 1.4 GHz.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The correlation of DOL and X-ray luminosity is stronger than those found previously using ground-based data.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results suggest that DOL traces hot gas in galaxy clusters.

 We present new results on the color magnitude distribution (CMD) of field galaxies in the redshift range 0<z<3, based on deep optical imaging data obtained with Subaru/Suprime-Cam at the prime focus telescope of National Astronomical Observatory of Japan.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We use two different samples in our analysis; one is a sample from about 12000 spectroscopically confirmed galaxies selected from the Sloan Digital Sky Survey Data Release 7 (SDSS DR7), which covers an area of ~10deg2 around the North Galactic Pole (NGP).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The other is a sample of about 10000 photometrically selected galaxies over an area of ~30deg2 centered on the Hubble Deep Field South (HDF-S).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The CMD shows that there are three distinct galaxy populations in terms of their rest-frame colors as well as luminosities.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These are: red-sequence early-type galaxies, green valley late-type galaxies, and blue cloud star-forming galaxies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition we find that the fraction of blue cloud galaxies increases towards higher redshifts up to z~2.5-3.0, while it decreases again beyond this epoch.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This trend can been explained by the fact that most massive galaxies have already formed stars before z~3, so they become redder than less-massive ones afterwards; therefore more massive galaxies dominate the red-sequence population at high-z.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In the other hand, less-massive galaxies continue forming stars until today, resulting in larger fractions of blue cloud galaxies at lower redshifts.
